intro: [WRONG START] Astragalus pephra-gmenus, commonly known as the yellow milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Astragalus pephra-gmenus plays a role in soil stabilization and is a food source for various pollinators and herbivores.
